column4: I have a problem with my network/router setup and I can't figure it out. Let's say my router is at 1.2.3.4 or example.com, and I have 2 computers at 192.168.1.10, and 192.168.1.20, I've set up ssh on both. If I do 'ssh 192.168.1.10' then everything works. Connecting from outside the network like 'ssh 1.2.3.4' or 'ssh example.com' works also - i've done port 22 forwarding to 192.168.1.10:22. But from either computer, if I do 'ssh 1.2.3.4' it doesn't wor
k. Why would that be? Both are clean installed. (No ssh configs, no iptables config, no nothing)
that can never be done because both the PCs are on the LAN interface of the router and you cant reach the WAN IP from within the LAN due to NATting
can you elaborate a bit?
it means that you cant ring the doorbell of your house from inside the house
if that were a good analogy
you cant fix it. you need to use the LAN IP of the router to ssh into it
which is in your case most probably 192.168.1.1
is there something that prevents you from sshing using the LAN ip of the router?
